remarks: The indexed union of a function's values is the union of its image under the index class.  This version of ~ funiunfvdm uses a bound-variable hypothesis in place of a distinct variable condition.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 10-Jan-2019.)
statement:
funiunfvf.1 $e |- F/_ x F $.
funiunfvdmf $p |- ( F Fn A -> U_ x e. A ( F ` x ) = U. ( F " A ) ) $.
$d A x $.
